articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats as England take on Sweden in the quarter-finals of the UEFA Women's Euro 2025.
articles.title: Sweden vs England Lionesses LIVE: Women's Euros quarter-final kick-off time, line-ups & updates

articles.description: Rory McIlroy delights and frustrates in equal measure as Matt Fitzpatrick ends day one of the 153rd Open Championship in a five-way tie for the lead.
articles.title: The Open 2025: Rory McIlroy three back as Matt Fitzpatrick shares lead at Royal Portrush

articles.description: After a hectic week, Newcastle look to have fended off Liverpool's interest in Alexander Isak, with the Premier League champions turning to Eintracht Frankfurt's Hugo Ekitike.
articles.title: Alexander Isak and Hugo Ekitike: What has gone on this week?

articles.description: The British and Irish Lions will have even "greater confidence" of beating Australia in the first Test after seeing the Wallabies' under-strength line-up, says Ugo Monye.
articles.title: Australia v British and Irish Lions: Team news will boost tourists, says Ugo Monye

articles.description: Manchester United make a third bid for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo that could be worth up to £70m.
articles.title: Bryan Mbeumo: Manchester United make £70m bid for Brentford forward

articles.description: Ruth Chepngetich, the women's marathon world record holder, is provisionally suspended by the Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) for a banned substance.
articles.title: Ruth Chepngetich: Women's marathon world record holder suspended for doping

articles.description: Rapper Snoop Dogg becomes a co-owner and investor at Swansea City after taking a minority stake in the Championship club.
articles.title: Snoop Dogg: Rapper becomes Swansea City investor and co-owner

articles.description: Super Bowl winner Bryan Braman dies at the age of 38 having been diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer in February.
articles.title: Bryan Braman: Super Bowl winner dies at the age of 38

articles.description: Tadej Pogacar regains the overall lead of the Tour de France after storming up the Hautacam climb to win stage 12 by over two minutes from Jonas Vingegaard.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Tadej Pogacar wins stage 12 summit finish to regain race lead

articles.description: Ons Jabeur says she is to take a "step back" from tennis for her own wellbeing as she has not "felt happy on court for some time now".
articles.title: Ons Jabeur to 'step back' from tennis for own wellbeing
